lexUnit.name: act.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to behave in a certain way.

sentence.text: At times , especially following the leakage of so-called ` medical evidence " to a Sunday newspaper , it appeared he was acting independently .
The Lord Chancellor will be given power to make rules allowing magistrates to disallow a solicitor 's costs or order him to pay costs if he fails to act reasonably competently or expeditiously .
Mr Shephard would like legislation to make sure that anglers act responsibly and compassionately .
In one case , the Appeal Court found a local authority had acted unlawfully by failing to consult residents properly before closing a home .

Since that was highlighted , several witnesses have come forward and told Gilmour 's lawyer , Gordon Ritchie , that they were aware of a lorry-driver acting suspiciously on the afternoon of the murder .
They challenged a man who was seen acting suspiciously at a horses ' rest home near their RAF base .
We must act responsibly .
South Africa claimed that since it was a party to the dispute the Security Council had acted illegally in depriving it of its right of audience under United Nations Charter , Article 32 .
Injunctions were sought to prevent this , but the judge had some difficulty in finding that the demonstrators were acting illegally .
The Commission is pledged to act independently of national or sectional interests .
If you see someone attempting or actually stealing a vehicle , or see someone acting suspiciously near vehicles -- ring the police immediately .
Surely what counts , from the point of view of the person in authority , is not what the subject thinks but how he acts .
How you act at work gives certain messages to all the people you work with .
If you want to know what a man is really like , take notice of how he acts when he loses money .
` You remember how he acted when I came out ? "
For more evidence that addictions have something in common in the way they act on the brain as a whole , no matter which pathways they stimulate , look at the pictures on this page .
Children should see that from the way I act , not from what I tell them to think " .
Though I agreed with their political views , I could not condone the way they acted and was glad to see them go at last .
He intrigued her , there was something about the way he acted , the way he spoke that made him different from all the other vagrants that she had met .
I say , ` We treat you guys like that because of the way you act .
Call a child stupid often enough , and she will act as if she were stupid , which almost amounts to becoming stupid .
I 've been acting as if I hate her . "
Begin to act as if your new belief were true .
` I do n't know what this is all about , or why you 're acting as if the bogyman is on your heels , but I suppose I 'll have to listen to you . "
We act and will continue to act as if we have free will , whether our actions are determined or not .
We acted as if we owned RCA , that we were RCA , that we had this corporation .
Is Dr Campbell saying that Christ did not really take our sin upon himself but acted as if he did ?
Cranston , however , acted as if she was an old friend , flattered and fussed her .
He had decided to act as if they liked each other ; he did n't know how he affected her and he was n't going to know .

There are important questions in relation to housing policy concerning the extent to which a free market can operate and the extent to which public housing authorities should act as if they were private business concerns .
Each department acts as if it is the purchaser of another department 's production and then ` sells " on materials that it has processed for the next stage of production .
As time passed , however , the Church censors began to act as if the distinction were of no importance .
Nevertheless the third party and his advisers seem to have acted as if such a direction had been given , for a document expressed to be a defence and counterclaim of the third party has been served .
Why not just ignore the decision and act as if it was never made ?
Isaac said , and it was only then that Alan realized that he was acting as if he knew .
Trust Claire to act as if she were the centre of attention .
He could n't forget he 'd been an Army sergeant , he talked like one and acted as if he was still on a parade ground or something .
D'Aubigny himself acted as if Angus was scarcely there .
By the end , he acted as if he 'd said nothing to me at all earlier about being worried , being followed and everything and he turned the conversation round to me and my future .
But at all times I would prefer them to act as if they have non-speaking parts .
While he was courting her , John was very protective towards mother and son , and acted like a big daddy to them both .
She acted like an old woman sometimes , though she was n't quite -- probably no older than thirty .
He found himself impossibly tongue-tied ; his cheeks coloured and he cursed himself for acting like a teenager .
Senna , Mansell , Prost : Gaug 's top three , but do they act like champions ?
They did n't act like police , did they ? "
They acted as if they had no choice in the matter .
The poor saps come round here and act like they 're his equals , and he plays with them .
` She acted extremely courageously , " added the spokesman .
Where a person is actually being made the subject of an unlawful attack by another , he is entitled to act in self-defence , and use force to do so .
Tremayne , sensing it also , fussed over her even more than usual and Fiona herself made visible efforts to act normally and as she said ` be sensible " .
He came in so unexpectedly I probably acted dumb at first .
He had been hopelessly spoiled as a child and as an adult continued to act as he chose , accepting neither advice nor criticism .
